title: Terrifying moment a huge great white shark swims within metres of 30 unsuspecting swimmers on Aus...
text:
This is the terrifying moment a shark swam within metres of a group of 30 swimmers.

The footage, captured on Thursday at Forster on the New South Wales Mid North Coast, shows the predator lurking beneath the water as people enjoy the surf.

A man first spotted the two-metre juvenile great white shark as he filmed the sunrise with his drone.

The footage, captured at Forster on the New South Wales Mid North Coast, shows the apex-predator cruising along the edge of the coastline as a cohort of swimmers return to shore

He saw the shark approaching the swimmers before flagging down a nearby surf skier who paddled over to alert them.

The large group, who swim at the beach every day regardless of the weather conditions, carried on with their dip.

At one point, the shark can be seen as close as five to six metres away from an unaware water-dweller, the man who filmed the incident said.

'It does take a bit of an interest, but no sooner has it had a look and realised it's not food, that it just turns around 180 [degrees] and swims to the other end of the beach,' he told Daily Mail Australia.

'The hype around sharks is generally negative, but this sort of shows -especially these juvenile sized white sharks- that they just don't see us as a threat or a food source.

'Sharks tend to get a bad wrap, so it's good to see that it's not always entirely true.'
description: This is the terrifying moment (pictured) a shark grazed within metres of a group of 30  swimmers.
authors: Tita Smith For Daily Mail Australia
